Welcome to AutoQuakePycker’s documentation!¶

mainscript.py¶

test 30/09/19 Tried using polarisation analysis as well (e.g. Ross et al. and Bailard et al.) - P and S filters and Dip-Rectilinearity value but did not produce consistent results - bad polarisations - bad rotations - noisy data??? These sections have been commented out. 04/11/19 Found that separate filters are needed for P and S-waves Added integration for S-wave picking

Final refinement takes S-picks on the T-component only to ensure that S is not mispicked as Sp precursors. Also computes magnitudes. TODO: Consider picking on radial as well as transverse? (Preferentially select tranverse) TODO: Check memory usage - are some variables being appended to? TODO: Process TRN events TODO: 8/11 Discovered some duplicates with Lidong’s catalog (auto origin time from lassie was too far off to be detected TODO: Implement Sippl approach: If RMS too high, progressively remove picks with largest residuals until suitable RMS is found TODO: On first step, only use stations that are closest, then incorporate more distant arrivals in later iteration. Do this 1 pick at a time if after relocation the single residual of the new pick fell below a distance‐dependent goal residual (P:0.6 s + (traveltime)*0.015); (S: 1.0 s + (traveltime)*0.015

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.CF_kurtosis(kurt_win_size, tr)¶

This is the Kurtosis function of Baillard et al. (2014, SRL) (Eq. 10). Sets values outside of window to NaN.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.add_picks(sta, e, orig_time, st)¶

Add picks made to ObsPy event structure. :param sta: variable station & picking data. :type sta: dict :param e: event. :type e: ObsPy event object :param orig_time: event origin time. :type orig_time: ObsPy UTCDateTime object :param st: stream of ObsPy traces containing data. :type st: Obspy stream object

Returns

event containg added picks.

Return type

e (ObsPy event object)

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.compute_magnitude(evt, st)¶

Compute local magnitude for event. Uses the same approach as Bie et al. (2019, SRL), although we don’t bother with checking signal-to-noise ratio this time. Args:

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.compute_noise_levels(tr)¶

Get simple estimate of trace noise level using STA/LTA function - similar to thhat described by Baillard et al. (2014, BSSA).

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.do_smooth(d, WT, sample_rate)¶

Simple windowing smoothing function. (takes data to right of smoothing point).

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.get_best_picks(sta, max_wind, orig_time, comps, sptype)¶

Define best Picks Choose whether to use fixed min S-P time or variable S-P time depending on P-arrival time and Vp/Vs ratio (Wadati method) This is quite messy. Could benefit from some improvements.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.get_theoretical_tt(event)¶

Find theoretical arrival times from NLLoc Time2EQ (containing 1 event).

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.kurt_transform_f2(f1, kurt_win_size, tr)¶

Apply transformations as per Baillard (BSSA). Remove neg slope of the CF from the sliding kurtosis fonction.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.kurt_transform_f3(f2, kurt_win_size, tr)¶

Remove the linear trend of F2. Eq. 12

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.kurt_transform_f4(f3, kurt_win_size, tr)¶

Find greatest minima correspond to the greatest onset strengths.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.plot_record_section(st_sta)¶

TODO

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.plot_sta_results(sta, st_sta, runtype, orig_time, pdf, fig, cmps)¶

Plot picking results for each station

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.process_events(cat_data, n_run)¶

This is the main function that runs a given set of events and does the multi-stage refinement.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.process_station(sta, st_sta, dist, ev_dict, evt, orig_time, phase, cmps)¶

Get ready to process data. Sets up emtpy arrays. Checks noise level of data.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.process_trace(n_tr, tr, sta, orig_time, cmps)¶

Process picking on each trace parsed by process_station.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.refine_events(st, stations_dist, cmps, max_pick_diff, evt, do_plot, n_refine, fig, sptype, path_to_figs, ev_dict, ev_id, rot=False)¶

This is one of the main functions of this code. It processes a refinement attempt for each event.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.relocate_nlloc(evt_refined)¶

Carry out relocation using newly picked events in NonLinLoc.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.rotate(st, evt)¶

Rotate raw 3-component data to ZRT coordinate system. Throws up flag if rotation cannot be done.

AutoQuakePycker.mainscript.write_evt(evt, ev_id)¶

Write refined event with new picks to stationxml file
